alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 3:26PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Big Horn and south central Treasure Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 325 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles southeast of Custer, or 17 miles northeast of Hardin, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail with heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Big Horn and south central Treasure Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
